data.title: Please Tag v1.3.1
data.body:
Hi,

Please tag version 1.3.1 of vscode. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Discuss about the clickBehavior on explorer to open editor
data.body:
#### 1. Down or Up

Now we can open an editor by **mouse down** on explorer tree.
I am very surprised why not **mouse up** or **click** to open an editor.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/views/explorerViewer.ts#L377

I can't stand it.
#### 2. Double Click

I hope add a configure to allow user open editor by **double click** on explorer tree rather than  **click**.  I think it's easy.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/views/explorerViewer.ts#L464

change to

```
let needOpen = !configuration.explorer.openWhenDoubleClick || isDoubleClick;
if (needOpen) {
    this.openEditor(stat, preserveFocus, event && (event.ctrlKey || event.metaKey), isDoubleClick);
}
```

data.title: Paste doesn't work in terminal in VSCode windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.10586

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open terminal with Ctrl Shift `
2. press Ctrl+V, you see ^V entered
3. pressing Ctrl+V in just cmd.exe (running it separately) pastes the clipboard
4. using Edit->Paste menu in VS Code works. Interesting, this menu has shortcut Ctrl+V

data.title: CSS Class Completion Extension locks up whole of VS Code v1.3 or v1.3.1
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:35:06.227Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.3.9600

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install previously good working extension https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Zignd.html-css-class-completion 
2. Open a folder of HTML/CSS/JS project or just an HTML file to trigger 'HTML CSS Class Completion: Fetching CSS rules from CSS files, please wait.' extension running message.
3. Shortly after about 80% of the time the whole of VS Code main window will become unresponsive. Not able to scroll opened file, move text cursor or click on any VS Code UI elements or Explorer Tree. Only elements that still respond are top File, Edit, View, Goto, Help menu dropdowns.

Issue only started happening with VSCode v1.3.0, still present with VSCode v.1.3.1 even after uninstalling and re-installing extension.

Not just myself getting this issue, as can be seen by new 1 star reviews being left at bottom User Reviews section for extension at https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Zignd.html-css-class-completion

data.title: "Feature can only be used in a .ts file." when switching the language mode to TypeScript in a .js file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: all versions, tested also on latest: 1.4.0-insider 50a0945d8de129472b154fa514ba5328897d3be1
- OS Version: OS X 10.11

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a TypeScript file with a `.js` extension
2. Change the language mode inside VSCode to "TypeScript" (defaults to JavaScript in files with a `.js` extension)
3. Add some TypeScript specific code, e.g. `interface ABC {}`

Causes an error: 

> 'interface declarations' can only be used in a .ts file.

Mentioned in the discussion here: https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/7926

data.title: Feature Request: Left Side Panel showing Opened Folder should have a shortcut to launch File Explorer and Command-line tool
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Feature Request:
Left Side Panel showing Opened Folder should have a shortcut to launch File Explorer and Command-line tool having Opened Folder as present working directory.

data.title: Freezes and slow performance
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.11.5
- Env:  working with Unity 5.3

Steps to Reproduce:

Frequent freezes working with Unity project(C#).
Particularly prominent when moving large chunk of code around. Background electron helper process runs at 100% cpu. It used to be much better before the VSCode 1.3 update.

It's hard to describe the exact steps since it may depend on my project size. But it should be pretty obvious in mid sized Unity project.

If this is the Intellisense running, it's probably good to have a bar indicator or something to make it more bearable.

data.title: Why does Ctrl + Shift + W close the VSCode
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press down Ctrl + Shift + W
2. Only only all tabs, but also the VSCode application will be closed.

Shouldn't it just close all tabs opened?

data.title: Refactoring the name of local variable is not updated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1 Commit e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to a function 
2. Select a parameter
3. Press F2
4. Type a new name
5. Wait until doomsday

It IS renamed, but you can't see it. I have to change file (two times Ctrl+TAB) to see, that it was renamed.

data.title: Clean up side by side container
Tilde (~) character not available in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.3.1 (e6b4afa53e9c0f54edef1673de9001e9f0f547ae, 2016-07-12T13:31:10.994Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.5.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal
2. Press alt+n
3. no tilde character is produced in terminal

BUT
if you press alt+n in the normal editor pane the character can be entered.

data.title: Archlinux - ms-vscode.csharp - "Error while installing .NET Core Debugger"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Archlinux 4.6.3 - KDE 5.7.1
- Mono Version: 4.3.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Extract VSCode
2. mkdir test; cd test; dotnet new
3. Start VSCode and Open Folder for newly created "test"
4. Enable recommended "ms-vscode.csharp" (and restart VSCode)
   
   ```
   Error while installing .NET Core Debugger
   ```
5. View Log
   
   ```
   ...
   Creating /home/username/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.2.2/coreclr-debug/project.json
   Telemetry is: Enabled
   
   log  : Restoring packages for /home/username/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.2.2/coreclr-debug/project.json...
   
   error: System.IO 4.1.0 provides a compile-time reference assembly for System.IO on .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0, but there is no run-time assembly compatible with arch.-x64.
   ...
   log  : Writing lock file to disk. Path: /home/username/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.2.2/coreclr-debug/project.lock.json
   
   log  : /home/username/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.2.2/coreclr-debug/project.json
   log  : Restore failed in 2012ms.
   
   Error: 
   Errors in /home/username/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.2.2/coreclr-debug/project.json
   
   Error:     System.IO 4.1.0 provides a compile-time reference assembly for System.IO on .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0, but there is no run-time assembly compatible with arch.-x64.
   ...
   System.Threading.Timer on .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0, but there is no run-time assembly compatible with arch.-x64.
   One or more packages are incompatible with .NETCoreApp,Version=v1.0 (arch.-x64).
   
   dotnet exited with error code 1
   ```

That is only part of the issue. The other part relates to omnisharp which I think I'll be submitting to their repository.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, build 10240

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Right click on VS icon in task bar
2. Select 'New Window'

Actual result- In task manager I can see new process starts, but it disappear in 2 seconds.
Expected result- New instance of VS is opened.

data.title: Debug variable overlay disappears when mouse not over text editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.4.0-insider (commit 50a0945)
- OS Version: Windows 7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start a JavaScript or TypeScript application in debugging mode (F5)
2. Set a breakpoint
3. Hit the breakpoint
4. Mouse-over a variable
5. The "debug variable"? overlay appears
6. Move the mouse cursor still inside that overlay, but outside of the editor region
7. The overlay disappears

Description: When I wanted to debug an application, I used the debugger with the "variable overlay" to inspect variables inside the editor. However, when I wanted to inspect a variable that was rendered in that overlay _but_ was outside of the editor region, the overlay disappeared, even though it should have had the mouse focus.

The following image shows what I mean:
![debug_overlay_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7488613/16797622/acd9e50c-48e8-11e6-9b62-7a1e3a13ebd8.png)

data.title: Treat erb files as ruby files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3.1
- OS Version: Debian Stretch

erb files are displayed as plain text. One has to manually change language mode to 'ruby' every time to get proper syntax highlighting. Please fix this.
Also, is there any method to manually treat a file with some unknown extension as a file of a particular language. For example, user can make a change/setting to consider .erb files as Ruby files, etc.

data.title: Lots of functions don't work

- OS Version: Windows 10.1511, 
  -PowerShell Extension version: 0.6.1
# Symptom
1. "Find All References" show empty window or "No result" window. So as "Go to definition". 
2. Auto complete doesn't work to show related PowerShell cmdlet.
3. Ctrl+ mouse hover on function name, doesn't show underline and can't click to jump function declaration. 

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Open VSCode
2.  Open PS1 script.

data.title: Breakpoint on first line of Nodejs code is not hit upon Debug Launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.3
- OS Version: Windows 7 SP1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Go to https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/runtimes/nodejs
2. Follow the instructions
3. Place a breakpoint on line 1.
4. Launch Debugger
5. The program should pause execution due to breakpoint on line 1, but the breakpoint is not hit and code executes without pausing.
